channel.title: Talks By John H. Groberg
channel.description: General Conference talks by John H. Groberg.

image.title: General Conference talks by John H. Groberg.

item.title: On Accepting the Call
item.description: My dear brethren, on occasions such as this there is much to be felt, but little to be said. I feel it important that I say four things.

item.title: “There Is the Light”
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters—and significantly that includes everyone—I ask for your faith and prayers, that that which is said and heard may be both said and heard under the influence of the Spirit of God, for I have long since learned that only as

item.title: “Come Home, Felila”
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I ask for your faith and prayers that the Lord’s Spirit might touch our hearts as together we consider an item vital to our happiness here and hereafter.

item.title: Writing Your Personal and Family History
item.description: My dear brethren, I ask that our faith be united so the Lord’s spirit may touch our hearts.

item.title: The Power of Family Prayer
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I ask for your faith and prayers as we consider a vitally important key to our happiness and success in life. I speak this morning on the importance and power of family prayer.

item.title: The Power of Keeping the Sabbath Day Holy
item.description: How I pray for the Spirit of the Lord to continue to be with all of us, as it has been thus far.

item.title: The Beauty and Importance of the Sacrament
item.description: One of the most important invitations ever issued to us and to all mankind is to “come unto Christ and be perfected in him.” (.) How do we do that? One of the most beautiful and important ways is through the ordinance of the sacrament.

item.title: The Lord’s Wind
item.description: The fourth article of faith states: “We believe that the first principles and ordinances of the Gospel are: first, Faith in the Lord Jesus Christ; second, Repentance; third, Baptism by immersion for the remission of sins; fourth, Laying on of hands f

item.title: Priesthood Power
item.description: While the power of the priesthood is unlimited, our individual power in the priesthood is limited by our degree of righteousness or purity.

item.title: The Power of God’s Love
item.description: Filled with His love, we can endure pain, quell fear, forgive freely, avoid contention, renew strength, and bless and help others.
